intro: Diplusodon rectinervis, commonly known as the narrow-veined diplusodon, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite leaves with parallel venation. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, arranged in whorled clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded understory habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
